title: Rosetta Stone
historicalSignificance: It was key to deciphering Egyptian hieroglyphs.
description: The Rosetta Stone is a granodiorite stele inscribed with a decree issued in Memphis, Egypt, in three scripts: Greek, Demotic, and Hieroglyphic.

title: Terracotta Army Soldier
currentLocation: Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum, China
historicalSignificance: Symbolizes China's first unification and funerary art.
description: These life-sized statues were buried with China's first emperor to protect him in the afterlife.

title: Mona Lisa
historicalSignificance: Considered the most famous painting in the world for its artistic techniques and mystery.
description: Portrait by Leonardo da Vinci, believed to depict Lisa Gherardini, wife of Florentine merchant Francesco del Giocondo.
preservationStatus: Secured behind bulletproof glass, controlled lighting and temperature

title: Sultanganj Buddha
currentLocation: Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery, UK
historicalSignificance: Largest known early metal Buddhist statue from the Gupta period.
description: This life-sized bronze statue of Buddha exemplifies ancient Indian metal casting techniques and Buddhist art.
preservationStatus: Indoor museum display with temperature and humidity control
